title: Netflix's 'Stranger Things' Season 4 Is Coming Next Summer; Other returning shows in 2022 include 'Locke & Key,' 'Alice in Borderland';
text:
The anticipated fourth season of "Stranger Things" will premiere in the summer, though Netflix didn't give an exact date. The show, one of the streaming giant's biggest breakout hits, has led to numerous merchandise tie-ins, including "Stranger Things" sneakers by Nike Inc., limited edition Coca-Cola Co. cans and special boxes of Cheerios, Lucky Charms and other General Mills Inc. cereals.

Other shows returning next year include a third season of "Locke & Key," the fantasy-horror drama; a second season of "Alice in Borderland," based on a graphic novel of the same name; and a third season of the superhero saga "The Umbrella Academy."

New series coming in 2022 include an animated one based on Hasbro Inc.'s Magic: The Gathering card game; "The Midnight Club," based on horror books by author Christopher Pike; and a show adapted from videogame franchise "Resident Evil."

"Squid Game," which Netflix said was its biggest hit ever, wasn't on the list. The company said in November that a second season wasn't confirmed yet, even though the creator of the South Korean dystopian drama told reporters he was plotting a new season in his mind.

Netflix listed premiere dates for some of its shows launching early next year. A new series inspired by horror podcast "Archive 81" will debut Jan. 14. Another season of "Raising Dion," about a boy with super-hero-like abilities, will be released Feb. 1; and a spinoff of cable channel History's "Vikings" will come Feb. 25, with this one called "Vikings: Valhalla."

Separately, Amazon.com Inc., which has a rival streaming service, said Tuesday that its Emmy-award winning comedy series "The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel" will begin its fourth season on Feb. 18.

Write to Joseph Pisani at joseph.pisani@wsj.com

Netflix's 'Stranger Things' Season 4 Is Coming Next Summer
